Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Legal_Provision_Involved: Section 9 of the Crown Liability and Proceedings Act
Outcome: Motion to strike denied except for 'wrongfully' in termination allegation

Legal_Issue: Whether statutory bars prevent claims despite pension receipt
Governing_Law: Section 9 of the Crown Liability and Proceedings Act
Application_Facts: Plaintiff suffered injuries during and after deployment; claims distinct from pension-compensated disabilities
Decision_Outcome: Motion to strike denied except for 'wrongfully' termination language

Legal_Issue: Whether fiduciary duties extend post-discharge and allow additional damages beyond pension
Governing_Law: Section 9 of the Crown Liability and Proceedings Act
Procedural_Stage: Motion to strike under Rule 221(1)(a) of the Federal Court Rules
Evidence_Assessment: Not plain and obvious that injuries were covered by pension
Decision_Outcome: Claim allowed to proceed, except for 'wrongful' termination allegation
